text: Captain Vijayakanth's Funeral: With Teary Eyes, People Pay Final Respects To Actor-Politician Vijayakanth passed away on December 28 morning at 71. A huge crowd gathered at Koyambedu DMDK office in Chennai to pay final respects to the actor-politician. Vijayakanth passed away on December 28 morning at 71. Photo : Twitter Chennai: With tears in eyes and prayers in hearts, people paid final respects to Desiya Murpokku Dravida Kazhagam (DMDK) chief Vijayakanth at the Koyambedu DMDK office in Chennai. Vijayakanth passed away on December 28 morning at 71. The body of DMDK president and actor Vijayakanth was transported to Island Ground, Anna Salai on Friday morning. The remains were placed at Island Ground from 6 am to 1 pm to allow the public to bid their final farewell. Several celebrities, including actor Vijay and Rajinikanth showed up to pay their tribute to the late actor. Fondly referred to as 'Captain', Vijayakanth is known for his contribution to the Tamil film industry. Having appeared in 154 movies before entering politics, Vijayakanth made a significant impact in the South Indian film industry. In November, Vijayakanth was hospitalized at MIOT Hospital in Chennai due to a decline in his health. Experiencing symptoms of coughing and throat pain, he remained under medical observation for 14 days. PM Modi Condoles Vijayakanth's Demise Prime Minister Narendra Modi condoled the demise of Vijayakanth. In a post on X (formerly Twitter), PM Modi wrote, “Extremely saddened by the passing away of Thiru Vijayakanth Ji." “A legend of the Tamil film world, his charismatic performances captured the hearts of millions. As a political leader, he was deeply committed to public service, leaving a lasting impact on Tamil Nadu’s political landscape," the Prime Minister said. He added, “His passing leaves a void that will be hard to fill. He was a close friend and I fondly recall my interactions with him over the years. In this sad hour, my thoughts are with his family, fans and numerous followers. Om Shanti." Actor Vijayakanth was widely popular among people for his box-office blockbuster movies like Sattam Oru Iruttarai, Vallarasu, Ramana, Pulan Visaranai, Chatriyan, Chinna Gounder and Honest Raj.
